ovdesc.p: This screen is used to define specific weight to be used for payments in the payments hub. Apart from assigning weights for a payment (H- Heavy, M - Medium or L - Light), specific weight can be assigned to a payment to enforce special processing rules. A Heavy weight payment with a specific weight can attract a special fee for instance.
A record authorised in this screen will create or amend or reverse a record in store table, PPL.SPECIFICWEIGHT.

desc.p: Contains all the override messages which the user agreed to during Input. During the validation of a transaction, the system may provide the user with a series of screen override messages to indicate an anomaly.
Record Activation Code generated for the record by the payment's hub.
H-YYYYMMDDHHMMSSsss - History. Where: YYYY - year, MM - month, DD - day, HH - hour, MM - minutes, SS - seconds and sss - miliseconds.
The value is not editable by the user.

Specifies the order (sequence) of the record in the application. Based on the value, a record is prioritised in such a way that, it is given higher preference for selection under peeling logic applied in the payments hub.
Record Status Code generated for the record by the payments hub.
The value is not editable by the user.
The specific weight code that needs to be applied based on the originating source, message type and ranking.
Specifies the date from which the record is to be considered as active for payments processing.
Indicates the weight code for which a specific weight code is defined.
Describes the specific weight code defined.
Used for internal purpose. Value of this field determines values of fields, 'RAC' and 'RSC'
This field can hold upto 1 alphanumeric character and the value is not editable by the user.

Specifies the date until which the record is to be considered as active for payments processing.Post this date, the record will be set as Inactive by the payments hub.
